trial_identification.studytitle: The importance of nerve fibers and macrophage cell count in the diagnosis of endometriosis
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The importance of nerve fibers and macrophage cell count in the diagnosis of endometriosis

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Other reproductive health and childbirth disorders

interventions.interventions: Endometrial nerve fibers and macrophage cell count using endometrial biopsy. Just before the patient's planned operation starts, endometrial biopsies are taken. This is done with the help of an endometrial sampling cannula. This procedure is done only once and after the induction of anesthesia and takes approximately 5 minutes. Also some patients who are previously operated and have endometrial samples kept in the pathology lab are involved in the study.
interventions.comparator: Control group consists of biopsies and endometrial samples of patients who are not diagnosed to have endometriosis during operation.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Increase in the number of endometrial nerve fibers
primaryOutcome.timepoint: After all biopsies are taken, all of the samples are evaluated together

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Increase in the number of endometrial macrophage cells
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: After all biopsies are taken, all of the samples are evaluated together

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Cystoma ovarii, chronic pelvic pain, infertility, myoma uteri, tubal ligation,

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: AYDINCIK DEVLET HASTANESI KADIN HAST. VE DOGUM POLIKLINIGI AYDINCIK/MERSIN/TURKEY

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The aim of the study is to determine whether the detection of nerve fibers and increased number of macrophage cells in the layer of endometrium can be used in the diagnosis of endometriosis

ethicscommitee.ethicname: ISTANBUL UNIVERSITESI ISTANBUL TIP FAKULTESI KLINIK ARASTIRMALAR ETIK KURULU

contact.name: Cihan Cetin
